marketNews.title: Automotive Wholesales: Cars down 14% YoY in 2024, Motorcycles up 1.5% YoY
marketNews.content:
Gaikindo reported that national automobile wholesales in December 2024 reached 79,806 units (-6.4% YoY, +6.6% MoM). This result made total automobile wholesales for 2024 amount to 865,723 units (-14% YoY), equal to 102% of Gaikindo’s revised 2024 target of 850,000 units.

Astra International (ASII) recorded wholesales of 42,158 units (-11.5% YoY, +7% MoM) in December 2024, worse than the industry average, causing its market share to fall to 52.8% (December 2023: 56%, November 2024: 52.6%). By brand, Daihatsu was the main driver of ASII’s wholesales in December 2024 with 13,057 units (+2% YoY, +30% MoM), while Toyota+Lexus sales reached 26,667 units (-17% YoY, -1.2% MoM). Cumulatively for 2024, ASII posted wholesales of 482,964 units (-14% YoY), in line with the industry decline, keeping its cumulative market share stable at 55.8% (2023: 55.7%).

Among ASII’s main competitors, Mitsubishi posted the relatively best performance in 2024 with wholesales of 99,938 units (-8.3% YoY), raising its market share to 11.5% (2023: 10.8%). Conversely, Honda was the weakest competitor, with sales dropping 32% YoY to 94,742 units. BYD recorded wholesales of 1,563 units in December 2024 and 15,429 units since it began deliveries in June 2024. Based on average monthly sales since June 2024, BYD’s wholesales (~2,200 units) have surpassed Wuling (~2,050 units) and Hyundai (~1,750 units).

Gaikindo Chairman I Jongkie Sugiarto said the association remains optimistic that automobile wholesales will recover to 1 million units in 2025, despite the value-added tax (VAT) increasing to 12% and the implementation of a tax offset scheme. According to Lydia Kurniawati Christyana, Director of the Ministry of Finance, the 2025 tax offset will not increase the burden on society because it will be accompanied by a reduction in motor vehicle tax rates and vehicle ownership transfer fees.

The Indonesian Motorbike Industry Association (AISI) reported that domestic motorcycle sales reached 403,480 units (-5.5% YoY, -21.3% MoM) in December 2024. This result brings total domestic motorcycle sales for 2024 to 6.3 million units (+1.5% YoY), in line with AISI’s 2024 target of 6.2-6.5 million units. AISI targets domestic motorcycle sales of 6.4-6.7 million units in 2025.

Key Takeaway: Although automobile wholesales are projected to recover to 1 million units in 2025, investors should monitor the impact of the 12% VAT and tax-offset implementation on sales in the early months of the year. Besides taxation, the launch of new models is another factor that could affect automobile sales. The presence of affordable hybrid cars priced around 300 million rupiah could act as a positive catalyst.

We also anticipate that motorcycle sales performance in 2025 will remain better than automobile sales, driven by factors such as the unchanged VAT for most motorcycles sold in Indonesia and a government stimulus package aimed at the lower-middle income segment.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia forecasts retail sales growth in December 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia forecasts that retail sales increased by 5.1% month-on-month and 1% year-on-year in December 2024, driven by parts and accessories, as well as food, beverage and tobacco, in line with higher consumer demand ahead of the Christmas and New Year holidays. Retail sales in November 2024 grew 0.9% YoY (October 2024: +1.5% YoY) but fell 0.4% MoM (October 2024: -0.01% MoM), as most categories contracted due to reduced consumer demand caused by weather conditions that dampened activity.

marketNews.title: Indonesia coal production exceeds 2024 target
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) reported that Indonesia’s coal production in 2024 reached 831 million tonnes (+7.8% YoY), 17% above the 2024 target. Coal sales also rose to 811.54 million tonnes (+8% YoY), 8% above the 2024 target.

marketNews.title: Brent crude price rises to $78.6 per barrel
marketNews.content: Brent crude oil for the March 2025 contract strengthened by 2.22% to $78.6 per barrel on Friday (10 January) and is likely to record a third consecutive weekly gain. JPMorgan linked the price increase to heightened concerns over supply disruptions due to tightened sanctions on Russia and Iran amid low oil inventories, colder temperatures in the United States and Europe during winter, and improved sentiment from China’s stimulus measures.

marketNews.title: Malaysian palm oil stocks fall in December 2024
marketNews.content: The Malaysian Palm Oil Board reported that Malaysia’s crude palm oil (CPO) stocks fell 6.91% month-on-month to 1.71 million tonnes in December 2024 due to flooding, marking a three-month decline and the lowest level since May 2023. Meanwhile, CPO production dropped 8.3% MoM to 1.49 million tonnes, the lowest since March 2024. Malaysia’s CPO exports also fell 9.97% MoM to 1.34 million tonnes, the lowest in six months. CPO consumption in Malaysia surged 53% MoM in December 2024 to 309,865 tonnes.

marketNews.title: Pertamina to acquire 20% stake in Citicore Renewable Energy
marketNews.content: Citicore Renewable Energy (PSE: CREC) announced on Friday (10 January) that Pertamina’s subsidiary PT Pertamina Power Indonesia will purchase a 20% stake in the company for 6.7 billion Philippine pesos (approximately US$114.8 million). The transaction will be executed through the issuance of new shares at 3 pesos per share, below Citicore’s market price of 3.49 pesos per share on Friday. The proceeds will be used by Citicore to develop new renewable energy projects, with a target of 1 GW of renewable capacity added per year.

marketNews.title: MIND ID targets Inalum IPO in 2026
marketNews.content: Dilo Seno Widagdo, Director of Portfolio and Business Development at MIND ID, said on Tuesday (9 January) that an IPO for PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Inalum) is included in the company’s long-term plan (RJPP) for the 2026-2027 period. He noted that the equity story for Inalum must be refined first, as the company currently operates only an aluminium smelter in Kuala Tanjung, North Sumatra, with a production capacity of 250,000 tonnes per year.

marketNews.title: Indonesia aims to mobilize 700 trillion IDR private financing for infrastructure
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the Ministry of Public Works and Housing aims to mobilize up to 700 trillion rupiah of private financing for infrastructure projects over the next five years, partly through public-private partnership (PPP) schemes. This target is higher than the previous period’s realization of 440 trillion rupiah. Andi Rukman Nurdin, Chairman of the National Board of Joint Construction Executives, expressed optimism that the target can be achieved provided security and political stability, efficient licensing, and land acquisition guarantees.

marketNews.title: PacificLight Power wins hydrogen power plant project in Singapore
marketNews.content: PacificLight Power Pte. Ltd., a subsidiary of First Pacific Company Ltd. owned by Anthoni Salim, won a project to build a 600-MW hydrogen power plant using combined cycle gas turbine (CCGT) technology on Jurong Island, Singapore. The plant, valued at US$735 million, is scheduled to start operations in January 2029.

tickerNews.title: PTRO receives US$1 billion mining services contract from INCO
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Vale Indonesia (INCO) will award a mining services contract worth US$1 billion to Prajogo Pangestu’s Petrosea. The contract is intended for a mine in Bahodopi, Central Sulawesi, with a duration of ten years. The signing process has just begun and is expected to be completed by March 2025. Investor Relations at INCO have confirmed this information to Stockbit.

tickerNews.title: AKRA projects 2025 net profit of 2.4-2.6 trillion IDR
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo projects a 2025 net profit of 2.4-2.6 trillion rupiah. The target assumes oil and chemical sales volumes grow 5-7% YoY, oil margins remain stable, and land sales of approximately 80-110 hectares.

tickerNews.title: EMTK purchases ~121.6 million SCMA shares
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media (SCMA), purchased approximately 121.6 million SCMA shares at an average price of 165 rupiah per share on 2-3 January 2025. The total transaction value reached 20.1 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA increased from 61.91% to 62.07%.

tickerNews.title: ANTM explores acquisition of new gold mining blocks
tickerNews.content: Antam’s President Director Nicolas D. Kanter said the company is exploring the possibility of acquiring new gold mining blocks, including those abroad, because Antam cannot continue to rely solely on the Pongkor gold mine and gold purchases from other companies. He could not comment further on the development of the plan. Previously, General Manager of Antam’s Geomin Unit, Abdul Bari, in November 2024 indicated that the company was evaluating opportunities to acquire gold mines both domestically and internationally.

tickerNews.title: PANR commissioner purchases 11.7 million shares
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata commissioner Satrijanto Tirtawisata purchased 11.7 million PANR shares at an average price of 735 rupiah per share on 3-9 January 2025. The total transaction value was 8.6 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Satrijanto’s ownership in PANR rose from 7.81% to 8.66%.

tickerNews.title: IMPC shares purchased by PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Impack Pratama Industri, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, bought approximately 468.8 million IMPC shares at an average price of 320 rupiah per share on 7 January 2025. The total transaction value was 150 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa’s ownership in IMPC increased from 44.13% to 44.99%.

tickerNews.title: INPP sells 36.7% stake in PT Narpati Arjaya Properti
tickerNews.content: Indonesian Paradise Property announced the sale of 36.7% of PT Narpati Arjaya Properti shares to Hankyu Hanshin Properties ID-BWC LLC. The transaction value was about 652.7 billion rupiah, with proceeds intended for working capital and/or business development. After the transaction, INPP’s ownership in PT Narpati Arjaya Properti fell from 91.9% to 55.2%. PT Narpati Arjaya Properti is a subsidiary of INPP that owns the Beachwalk Shopping Centre Bali and Sheraton Bali Kuta Resort.
